miic.core.corr_fun.extend¶

extend(x, method='reflection', length='powerof2', size=0)[source]¶

Extend the 1D numpy array x beyond its original length

This function comes from MLPY package with just a minor change.

Parameters:
  • x (ndarray) – 1D ndarray.
  • method (string, optional, default: reflection) – Indicates which extension method to use. Possible choice are reflection, periodic and zeros.
  • length (string, optional, default:powerof2) – Indicates how to determinate the length of the extended data. Possible choices are powerof2 and double and fixed
Return type:

ndarray
Returns:

xe: Extended version of x

Basic Usage

>>> import numpy as np
>>> from corr_fun import extend
>>> a = np.array([1,2,3,4,5])
>>> xe = extend(a, method='periodic', length='powerof2')
>>> xe
array([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 1, 2, 3])
